name: places/ChIJeVx9irpZwokRyeeh-Y43keU
adrFormatAddress: 286 8th Ave, New York, NY 10001, USA

editorialSummary.text: Kettle-boiled bagels & assorted spreads headline this self-serve cafe's roster of daytime eats.

originalText.text:
This is an iconic New York-style bagel place that you'll love immediately. It's small and cozy. If you manage to get a table, especially one by the window like I did, you'll have a perfect breakfast experience.

First, they have a huge selection of bagels and a variety of spreads and fillings (eggs, salmon, etc.). You can have your bagel hot or cold, it's up to you. The coffee here is also good.

Secondly, and equally important, the people there are cool. You'll see locals and city visitors, dressed in both fancy upscale attire and simple jeans and sneakers. There are young handsome guys and women over 60 reading books. I enjoyed observing the guests and being part of this wonderful crowd. It's a lovely place to start your day.

originalText.text: I visited NYC this past weekend & my friend took me to this bagel shop. The bagel was sooo good and so was the cream cheese. The cream cheese was not as creamy and other places but the flavor was spot on. I also got a hot chocolate and it was delicious. Very good and not too sweet. I’ll definitely be coming back next time I visit.

The cream cheese was not as creamy and other places but the flavor was spot on. I also got a hot chocolate and it was delicious. Very good and not too sweet. originalText.text:
I visited on a Monday morning at 10:15am. It was crowded but I managed to get a seat at the side counter.

I ordered a Bacon Egg and Cheese in an everything bagel. It was delicious.

The ordering process was a bit confusing. I had to order at one counter, get a slip, and then order coffee and pay for the order at another counter. It took about 5 minutes to get my order. Not bad for a busy morning.

originalText.text: came here via a promotion. went for a dessert-y bagel and cream cheese combo and it did not disappoint. ordered the Blueberry bagel with Blueberry cream cheese. normally i order savory bagels but couldn't resist going for an all out blueberry experience. the Blueberry bagel is subtle in flavor and scent but has the right amount of crust and chew without being overpowered by berry-ness. the real standout is the blueberry cream cheese which is the sweet tart cream cheese that tastes like blueberry compote in cream cheese form. glad I took a shot on this dessert-y bagel option as Brooklyn Bagel made good on both the quality of the bagel and outstanding-ness of the cream cheese. the fast friendly service—despite the constant flow of hungry customers—is a nice touch. there's a good amount of seating in a clean casual interior. if you need carbs, come here and eat.

originalText.text: Love their bagels that are crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. They give a generous portion of their carried selection of cream cheeses. I got their scallion cream cheese which is filled with scallions on a sesame bagel. Their iced coffee was good too
